description.p: Rough and wild looking, a grizzled man silently moves through the forest, tracking the band of orc raiders that had moved into the peaceful farmland he protected. Clutching a shortsword in each hand, he leaps out from the cover of the forest, preying on the orcs when they stop to rest. In a flash, he becomes a whirlwind of steel.

After tumbling away from a blast of freezing air, a slender female elf finds her feet and draws her bow, letting loose another arrow at the white dragon. Shrugging off the wave of fear that emanates from the great beast, she releases her final arrow. With a piercing roar the terrible monster plummets to the ground and lies motionless.

Holding their hand high, a young dwarf whistles, and the hawk circling high above returns to the side of its master. Whispering instructions, the dwarf points to the owlbear they've been tracking. In a blur, the dwarf and their hawk move as one, and before the owlbear can react to the assault, it lies slain at the feet of the dwarven warrior.

Far from the bustle of cities and towns, past the hedges that shelter the most distant farms from the terrors of the wild, amid the dense-packed trees of trackless forests and across empty plains, rangers keep their unending watch.

Warriors of the wilderness, rangers specialize in tracking and hunting the monsters that threaten the edges of civilization; groups of raiders, rampaging beasts, terrible giants, and deadly dragons. They track their quarry as a predator does, moving stealthily through the wilds and hiding themselves in brush and rubble. Rangers focus on mastering devastating techniques and styles of combat. They often focus these martial abilities on one creature, aiming to slay their foe before they have a chance to retaliate.

Thanks to their familiarity with the wild, rangers can harness the power of nature to cast minor spells and enhance their hunting skills. Their magic, like their combat ability, emphasizes speed, stealth, and the hunt.

Though a ranger might make a living as a hunter, a guide, or a tracker, their true calling is to defend the outskirts of civilization from the ravages of the wild. In some places, rangers gather in secretive orders or join forces with druidic circles. Many rangers, though, are independent almost to a fault, knowing that, when a dragon or a band of orcs attacks, they may be the first, and possibly last, line of defense.

Their fierce dedication makes rangers well suited to adventuring. Accustomed to life far from the comforts of a dry bed and a hot bath, they make excellent guides for adventuring parties that have real experience with the wilds.

Consider the nature of your training. Did you train with a mentor, wandering the wilds together, or did you forge a magical connection to nature in your own way? No matter their background, most rangers choose to adventure to impart their knowledge of the wilds on to the next generation, securing the safety of civilization for years to come.

You can make a ranger quickly by following these suggestions. If you wish to focus on ranged attacks or hunting, make Dexterity your highest ability score, followed by Wisdom. Second, choose the Outlander background.

If you wish to focus more on skirmishing or fighting your foes head-on (like with dual-wielding), make Strength your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the Mercenary background.
As a ranger, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d10 per ranger level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per ranger level after 1st
Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields
Weapons: Simple weapons, martial weapons
Tools: None
Saving Throws: Strength, Dexterity
Skills: Choose three from Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Stealth, and Survival.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) chain shirt and a shield or (b) leather armor
(a) two shortswords or (b) two simple melee weapons
(a) a longbow and 20 arrows or (b) a martial weapon
(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

setters.set: A warrior who uses martial prowess and nature magic to combat threats on the edges of civilization.

multiclass.prerequisite: Wisdom 13 and either Strength 13 or Dexterity 13

setters.set: Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, martial weapons, and one skill from the ranger class skill list.

description.p: Your time in the wild has honed your skills, and you have acquired survivalist knacks; exploration, hunting, and tracking skills that imbue you with primal magic abilities.

At 1st level, you gain one knack of your choice. When you gain certain ranger levels, you gain additional knacks of your choice, as shown in the Knacks Known column of the Ranger Table. When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the knacks you know and replace it with another knack that you could learn at that level.

sheet.description: When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the knacks you know and replace it with another knack that you could learn at that level.

description.p: Your skill as an explorer and survivor are unsurpassed. At 1st level, choose one of the skill proficiencies you know from the ranger skill list. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency. You also learn to speak, read, and write one additional language of your choice. Most rangers choose to learn a language that is spoken by the enemies they specialize in hunting.

Upon reaching 10th level, you select another skill you are proficient in from the ranger skill list to gain the benefits of this feature, and you learn to speak, read, and write one additional language of your choice.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses a skill in which you are proficient of your choice. Additionally, you learn an extra language.

description.p: Your bond with nature allows you to place a mystical mark on a creature, designating them as your favored foe. Beginning at 2nd level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a 1st-level spell slot to mark the creature as your favored foe. Each time you hit your favored foe with a weapon attack (including the attack used to mark it) you deal an additional 1d4 damage of the weapon's damage type.
You can expend higher-level spell slots when you mark a creature as your favored foe, increasing the additional damage to the amount indicated in the table below.

The creature remains your favored foe for one minute, or until it is dead. If you mark another creature as your favored foe, the effect immediately ends for the previous creature. This bonus does not stack with the one granted by the hunter's mark spell.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot to mark the creature as your favored foe. Each time you hit your favored foe with a weapon attack (including the attack that marked the target) you deal additional damage based on the spell slot expended.

description.p: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
You are a master marksman, striking from afar. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

You have honed your other senses to fight even when you cannot see. You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.
Your training focused on defending yourself from your foes. While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

Your connection to the spirits of nature is stronger then most other rangers. You learn two cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list. They count as ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.
When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the druid spell list.
You have mastered the art of fighting with a single weapon. When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to weapon damage rolls.

You have trained to fight on, around, and in the water. As long as you are not wearing medium or heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed equal to your normal speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to armor class.

You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon. In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.
When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on hit. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a shield, the d6 becomes a d8.
In addition, at the start of each of your turns, you can deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you.
When you make an attack with a versatile weapon, and you are wielding no other weapon or a shield, you can use your bonus action to make an unarmed strike or shove attack.
You can use this bonus action even if you are wielding your versatile weapon with two hands.

By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does. See chapter 10 for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the ranger spell list.

The Ranger table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells. To cast one of your ranger spells of 1st-level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of ranger spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the ranger spell list. When you do so, choose a number of ranger spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + half your ranger level, rounded down. The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level ranger, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells. You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest.
You can use a druidic focus as a spellcasting focus for your ranger spells. See chapter 5, of the Player’s Handbook for a list of things that count as druidic foci.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your ranger spells, since your magic draws on your intimate relationship with nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a ranger spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

description.p: You can cast a ranger spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

sheet.description: You have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does.

description.p: Upon reaching 3rd level, you choose one of the following ranger archetypes; Beast Master, Hunter, Drake Warden, Sanguine Warrior, Slayer, Spellbreaker, or Stargazer, each detailed at the end of the class description. Your archetype grants features at 3rd, 7th, 11th, and 15th-level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at 18th level, your enhanced senses allow you to strike with perfect accuracy. Your attack rolls against creatures within 30 feet cannot have disadvantage.

sheet.description: Your attack rolls against creatures within 30 feet cannot have disadvantage.

description.p: You have become an unparalleled hunter of your enemies. At 20th level, when you hit your favored foe with a weapon attack you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: When you hit your favored foe with a weapon attack you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to {{wisdom:modifier}} (minimum of 1).

Within that range, you can see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th level ranger

You surmount mountainous heights like the most surefooted beasts of the land. You gain a 30 foot climbing speed, and you can use your reaction to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to your ranger level.
If you already have a climbing speed from another feature, your climbing speed increases by 10 feet.

sheet.description: You can use your reaction to reduce any falling damage you take by {{level:ranger}}.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th level ranger
You have learned to move through the water like the swiftest creatures of the sea. You gain a 30 foot swimming speed, and you can hold your breath for up to 1 hour while underwater.
If you already have a swimming speed from another feature, your swimming speed increases by 10 feet.

sheet.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour while underwater.

description.p: You have spent your life learning the ways of the wilderness, and it is rare that you lose your way. You, and any of your companions, cannot become lost, except by magical means, while traveling in natural environments.

sheet.description: You, and any of your companions, cannot become lost, except by magical means, while traveling in natural environments.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th level ranger, Explorer 1

At the end of each long rest, you can attune to your present environment. Examples include, but are not limited to: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, or swamp. While in your attuned environment you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You have advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom checks related to the native plants, animals, or ecosystem.
You find twice as much food when foraging or hunting.
You cannot be surprised unless you are incapacitated.
You gain a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: At the end of each long rest, you can attune to your present environment. While in your attuned environment you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom checks related to the native plants, animals, or ecosystem. You find twice as much food when foraging or hunting. You cannot be surprised unless you are incapacitated. You gain a bonus to your initiative rolls of {{wisdom:modifier}} (minimum of 1).

description.p: You have a deep knowledge of plants and their healing properties. You have advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to identify the medicinal properties of plants, and Wisdom (Medicine) checks made to stabilize creatures.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to identify the medicinal properties of plants, and Wisdom (Medicine) checks made to stabilize creatures.

description.p: Prerequisite: 3rd level ranger, Herbalist 1
You have learned to use the fruits of the earth to create healing poultices. You gain proficiency with the herbalism kit.

At the end of a long rest, you can use a herbalism kit and local plants to create one potion of healing. This potion retains its potency for a number of days equal to your proficiency bonus, after which it spoils and becomes inert.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can use a herbalism kit and local plants to create one potion of healing. This potion retains its potency for {{proficiency}} days, after which it spoils and becomes inert.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th level ranger, Herbalist 2

You can use your knowledge of local plant life to soothe your allies. If you, and up to five creatures who you touch, spend at least one Hit Die to regain hit points at the end of the short rest, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d8 hit points.

sheet.description: If you, and up to five creatures who you touch, spend at least one Hit Die to regain hit points at the end of the short rest, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d8 hit points.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th level ranger

You can draw on the surrounding environment to replenish your mystical power. At the end of a short rest, you can choose to recover expended spell slots of a combined level equal to or less than your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
Once you use this feature you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: At the end of a short rest, you can choose to recover expended spell slots of a combined level equal to or less than {{wisdom:modifier}} (minimum of 1).

description.p: Prerequisite: 3rd level ranger
Once you have a quarry in your sights it is rare that they escape. You have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored foe.

sheet.description: You have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored foe.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th level ranger, Slayer 1
Your tracking abilities have become supernaturally accurate. You always know the exact direction of your favored foe while you are on the same plane of existence.

sheet.description: You always know the exact direction of your favored foe while you are on the same plane of existence.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th level ranger, Slayer 2

Once per turn, when you hit your favored foe with a weapon attack, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw in addition to the normal damage of the attack. On a failed save, it is blinded, deafened, frightened, poisoned, or restrained (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: Once per turn, when you hit your favored foe with a weapon attack, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw in addition to the normal damage of the attack. On a failed save, it is blinded, deafened, frightened, poisoned, or restrained (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

description.p: You are a master at covering your tracks. While moving at a normal pace you, and up to five other creatures you are traveling with, produce no tracks or scent, and you cannot be tracked by mundane means unless you wish to be.

sheet.description: While moving at a normal pace you, and up to five other creatures you are traveling with, produce no tracks or scent, and you cannot be tracked by mundane means unless you wish to be.

description.p: Prerequisite: 3rd level ranger, Stalker 1
You have learned to hunt your prey while remaining unseen. You can take the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can take the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th level ranger, Stalker 2

You can conceal yourself from even the most advanced magic. You are always under the effects of the nondetection spell, and you cannot be tracked divination magic or other magical means unless you wish to be.

sheet.description: You are always under the effects of the nondetection spell, and you cannot be tracked divination magic or other magical means unless you wish to be.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th level ranger, Stalker 3

You can ward yourself with nature magic to briefly disappear from sight. When you take the Hide action on your turn, you, along with anything you are wearing, carrying, or have equipped, becomes invisible until the start of your next turn.
This invisibility ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

sheet.description: When you take the Hide action on your turn, you, along with anything you are wearing, carrying, or have equipped, becomes invisible until the start of your next turn. This invisibility ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

description.p: There are few natural obstacles that you cannot overcome, or guide others through safely. You ignore the effects of difficult terrain imposed by natural environments, such as forest undergrowth, snow drifts, swamp, or marshlands.
Also, you, and up to five other creatures you are traveling with, do not have your travel slowed by difficult terrain.

sheet.description: You ignore the effects of difficult terrain imposed by natural environments, such as forest undergrowth, snow drifts, swamp, or marshlands. Also, you, and up to five other creatures you are traveling with, do not have your travel slowed by difficult terrain.

description.p: Prerequisite: 3rd level ranger, Strider 1
Once in your sights, you pursue your quarries relentlessly. You can take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th level ranger, Strider 2

You can surmount almost any obstacle that would block your path. Your base movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you ignore the effects of difficult terrain imposed by spells, magical phenomena, and any other magical effects.

sheet.description: You ignore the effects of difficult terrain imposed by spells, magical phenomena, and any other magical effects.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th level ranger, Strider 3
You move through the world unhindered by even the most powerful magic and restraints. You are always under the effects of the freedom of movement spell while conscious.

sheet.description: You are always under the effects of the freedom of movement spell while conscious.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th level ranger

Your time in the wilds has hardened your body, and you can brace yourself to absorb incoming blows. As a bonus action on your turn, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can grant yourself {{constitution:modifier}} temporary hit points (minimum of 1).

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th level ranger, Survivor 1

You have trained your body to recover more rapidly than most. When you expend Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of a short rest, you gain a bonus to each Hit Die roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: When you expend Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of a short rest, you gain a bonus to each Hit Die roll of {{wisdom:modifier}} (minimum of 1).

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th level ranger, Survivor 2

You persevere even in the face of death. When you make a death saving throw you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). If this increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the d20.

sheet.description: When you make a death saving throw you gain a bonus to the roll of {{wisdom:modifier}} (minimum of 1). If this increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the d20.

description.p: You have a natural way with the wild animals of the world. You can communicate simple ideas to beasts using sounds and gestures, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks you make targeting animals that are already friendly towards you.

sheet.description: You can communicate simple ideas to beasts using sounds and gestures, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks you make targeting animals that are already friendly towards you.

description.p: Prerequisite: 3rd level ranger, Wild Insights 1

Your familiarity with the natural world has allowed you to bond you with a minor spirit of nature. You learn the find familiar spell. It counts as a ranger spell for you and you always have it prepared, but it doesn't count against the total number of spells you prepare each day. When you cast this spell your familiar is a fey creature.

sheet.description: When you cast the find familiar spell your familiar is a fey creature.

description.p: Rangers who develop intense bonds of trust with the creatures of the wild attract nature spirits known as primal beasts. Shapeshifting protectors of the wilderness, they join forces with rangers they perceive as worthy. The primal beast will fight side by side with their partner, taking the shape that best allows them to face the challenges at hand.

sheet.description: Rangers who develop intense bonds of trust with the creatures of the wild.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Beast Master Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.

Upon adopting this archetype at 3rd level, you gain a primal beast as a companion. It is friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. You choose the form your primal beast takes, selecting an appropriate stat block: Beast of the Air, Beast of the Earth, or Beast of the Sea. The stat block uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. Your beast bears primal markings, indicating its mystical origin.

In combat, the primal beast acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the beast can take any action of its choice.
If your primal beast has died within the last hour, you can touch it and expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher. After 1 minute, it returns to life with all its hit points restored.
When you finish a long rest, you can cause your primal beast to take on a new form, choosing a new stat block and appearance. The beast also vanishes if you die.

sheet.description: In combat, the primal beast acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the beast can take any action of its choice. If your primal beast has died within the last hour, you can touch it and expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher. After 1 minute, it returns to life with all its hit points restored. When you finish a long rest, you can cause your primal beast to take on a new form, choosing a new stat block and appearance. The beast also vanishes if you die.

description.p: The bond between you and your primal beast has grown, enhancing their resilience. Starting at 7th level, your primal beast has advantage on saving throws while it can see you.

sheet.description: Your primal beast has advantage on saving throws while it can see you.

description.p: Beginning at 11th level, when you command your primal beast to use their Attack action it can make two attacks, instead of one. The attacks of your primal beast also count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances.

sheet.description: When you command your primal beast to use their Attack action it can make two attacks, instead of one. The attacks of your primal beast also count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances.

description.p: The bond between you and your primal beast has been perfected, allowing you to share magical effects. Upon reaching 15th level, when you cast a spell that targets yourself, you can choose for the spell to effect both yourself and your primal beast, as long as it is within 30 feet of you.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell that targets yourself, you can choose for the spell to effect both yourself and your primal beast, as long as it is within 30 feet of you.

description.p: Dragons are some of the most powerful creatures in the multiverse, and even the most well-read scholars are unsure of the full magical potential of ancient dragons. Sometimes, for reasons that may be mysterious, a powerful ancient dragon will call upon a ranger who has proved themselves worthy of draconic power. These rare few are granted the boon of a minor draconic companion, known as a drake.

Known as Drake Wardens, form a mystical bond with their draconic companion that allows them to summon the drake to their side, and share in the awe inspiring power of dragons. Together with their drake, they venture forth, and as their bond deepens, both ranger and drake grow in draconic presence and mystical might.

sheet.description: Both ranger and drake grow in draconic presence and mystical might.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Drake Warden Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.

The bond you share with your drake creates a deeper connection to dragon kind, granting you understanding of their language and empowering your presence. Upon adopting this ranger archetype at 3rd level you learn to speak, read, and write draconic.
In addition, you learn the thaumaturgy cantrip, which counts as a ranger spell for you, but doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare each day.

sheet.description: You learn to speak, read, and write draconic. In addition, you learn the thaumaturgy cantrip, which counts as a ranger spell for you, but doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare each day.

description.p: Starting at 3rd-level, you can use an action to magically summon the drake bound to you. It appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet. The drake is friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. When you summon the drake, choose its Draconic Essence: acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison. The chosen type determines the drake’s damage immunity, the damage of its bite, and the damage of its Infused Strikes trait. The drake the Drake Companion stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the drake shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you command it to take another action from its stat block as a bonus action. If you are incapacitated, the drake can take any action of its choice.
Once you summon the drake, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to summon it.

The drake remains for a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the drake again, or until you die. Anything the drake was wearing or carrying is left behind when the drake vanishes.

sheet.description: You can use an action to magically summon the drake bound to you. It appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet. The drake is friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. When you summon the drake, choose its Draconic Essence: acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison. The chosen type determines the drake’s damage immunity, the damage of its bite, and the damage of its Infused Strikes trait. The drake the Drake Companion stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. In combat, the drake shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you command it to take another action from its stat block as a bonus action. If you are incapacitated, the drake can take any action of its choice. Once you summon the drake, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to summon it. The drake remains for a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the drake again, or until you die. Anything the drake was wearing or carrying is left behind when the drake vanishes.

description.p: The bond you share with your drake grows stronger. Starting at 7th level, while your drake is summoned, you are resistant to your it's Draconic Essence damage type, and the it's bite attack deals an additional 1d6 Draconic Essence damage.
In addition, when you summon your drake, you choose whether it is a Small or Medium creature, and it gains one of the following traits of your choice:

ul.li: Your drake takes on aquatic form. It can breathe both air and water, and it gains a swimming speed of 40 feet.
Your drake can take to the skies. It sprouts leathery wings from it's back and gains a flying speed of 40 feet.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, the bond between you and your drake allows you to produce elemental breath resembling a true dragon. As an action on your turn, either you or your drake can exhale a 30-foot cone of elemental breath. Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your ranger spell save DC. Creatures take 6d6 Draconic Essence damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
At 15th level this damage increases to 8d6.
Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend 3rd-level spell slot.

ul.li: Your drake's bite attack deals an additional 1d6 Draconic Essence damage (for a total of 2d6 extra damage).
When you or your drake takes damage while within 30 feet of the other, you can use your reaction to give yourself or your drake resistance to the damage from that attack.

description.p: With their varied skills, rangers can take up many roles; guide, naturalist, tracker, or guardian, but at their core rangers are all hunters. Rangers that lean into their role as a deadly predator, honing their combat skills, are known as hunters. These warriors accept their place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness. Walking this path, they master specialized techniques to better combat the threats they face. True hunters will face any foe; marauding gnolls, grotesque trolls, or terrible dragons

sheet.description: Rangers that lean into their role as a deadly predator

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Hunter Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.

Sometimes it takes a monster to destroy a monster. Rangers that take up the mantle of Sanguine Warrior undergo a blood ritual, known as the Hunter's Rite, to gain enhanced abilities. During this dark alchemical ritual, they sacrifice their very selves, mingling their blood with that of monsters, mutilating themselves in order to gain the power to destroy their foes.

sheet.description: Rangers that take up the mantle of Sanguine Warrior undergo a blood ritual to gain enhanced abilities.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Sanguine Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.

When you adopt this Archetype at 3rd-level, you undergo the Hunter's Rite, an alchemical ritual that suffuses your blood with sinister magic. You gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies and your in either History or Religion. When you make an ability check related to fey, fiends, or undead, with either of these proficiencies you have advantage on the roll.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies and your in either History or Religion. When you make an ability check related to fey, fiends, or undead, with either of these proficiencies you have advantage on the roll.

description.p: Starting at 3rd-level, you can draw on the dark magic in your blood to enhance your strikes. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one of your ranger Hit Dice to deal 2d10 necrotic damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The additional necrotic damage increases by 1d10 if the target is a fey, fiend, or undead.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one of your ranger Hit Dice to deal 2d10 necrotic damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The additional necrotic damage increases by 1d10 if the target is a fey, fiend, or undead.

description.p: Your body has adapted to the monstrous power that flows in your veins, enhancing your physical abilities. Starting at 7th-level, your movement speed increases by 5 feet, and whenever you make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant yourself a bonus to the roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Your movement speed increases by 5 feet, and whenever you make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant yourself a bonus to the roll of {{wisdom:modifier}} (minimum of 1).

description.p: Beginning at 11th-level, the dark magic in your blood, empowers your weapon strikes. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can deal an additional 2d8 necrotic damage to the target.

sheet.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can deal an additional 2d8 necrotic damage to the target.

description.p: You manifest the full potential of the dark magic from your Hunter's Rite ritual. Starting at 15th-level, you are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions, and you are always under the effects of the protection from good and evil spell.

sheet.description: You are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions, and you are always under the effects of the protection from good and evil spell.

description.p: Since the dawn of time the mortal world has been plagued by the scourge that is undeath. Created by dark emotions and malicious magic, ghosts, ghouls, and undead of all sorts have plagued the mortal races since they took their first steps.

As ancient as this threat itself, a brotherhood of rangers known as Slayers have protected the living from the dead. Willing to sacrifice their very selves, these warriors taint their soul with the foul magic of undeath. Once mastered, they use their dark powers to drive back the darkness itself. Giving up any chance of a normal life, Slayers work tirelessly to prevent the tide of undeath from overwhelming the living.

sheet.description: Willing to sacrifice their very selves, these warriors taint their soul with the foul magic of undeath.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Slayer Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.

Upon adopting this archetype at 3rd-level you gain the knowledge and skills necessary to hold back the tide of undeath. You gain proficiency in the Religion skill, and whenever you make an Intelligence (Religion) check related to undead creatures or the dark magic of necromancy you have advantage on the roll.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in the Religion skill, and whenever you make an Intelligence (Religion) check related to undead creatures or the dark magic of necromancy you have advantage on the roll.

description.p: Starting at 3rd-level, you learn to draw forth radiant power from your soul to augment your strikes. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Each time you hit that creature before the start of your next turn with a weapon attack, the creature takes an additional 1d4 radiant damage in addition to the normal damage of the attack.

sheet.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Each time you hit that creature before the start of your next turn with a weapon attack, the creature takes an additional 1d4 radiant damage in addition to the normal damage of the attack.

When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Each time you hit that creature before the start of your next turn with a weapon attack, the creature takes an additional 2d4 radiant damage in addition to the normal damage of the attack.

description.p: You have mastered the ability to temporarily discorporate. Starting at 7th-level, you can use a bonus action to enter a ghostlike state. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying becomes ethereal as well. While in this state you can move through solid objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn or return to normal inside an object or creature, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet you traveled.
This feature lasts for 1 minute, until you end it as a bonus action, or you are incapacitated. Once you use this feature you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You can use a bonus action to enter a ghostlike state. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying becomes ethereal as well. While in this state you can move through solid objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn or return to normal inside an object or creature, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet you traveled. This feature lasts for 1 minute, until you end it as a bonus action, or you are incapacitated.

description.p: Your strikes undercut regenerative abilities. Beginning at 11th-level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack it cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn. If the creature could normally pass through solid objects or other creatures it cannot do so until the start of your next turn.
In addition, the additional radiant damage from your Warrior of the Dawn feature increases to 2d4.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack it cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn. If the creature could normally pass through solid objects or other creatures it cannot do so until the start of your next turn.

description.p: You can sacrifice your own vitality to resist the grasp of death. Upon reaching 15th-level, when you would fall to 0 hit points but are not killed outright, you can use your reaction to expend your own Hit Dice to drop to 1 hit point instead.

sheet.description: When you would fall to 0 hit points but are not killed outright, you can use your reaction to expend your own Hit Dice to drop to 1 hit point instead.

description.p: Where there is power, there are those that abuse that power. Spellbreakers are a small, but dedicated, fraternity of rangers who specialize in hunting down spellcasters that use their arcane abilities to bring harm to others. While most pursue the life of a Spellbreaker for noble reasons, there are some who seek to destroy any who wield the weave. Most Spellbreakers operate in the shadows, only revealing themselves when the time is right and their success is a certainty. When one wrong move could end in disintegration, there is no room for error.

sheet.description: Spellbreakers are a small, but dedicated, fraternity of rangers who specialize in hunting down spellcasters

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Spellbreaker Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.

When you adopt this archetype at 3rd level you gain the skills necessary to hunt spellcasters of all kinds. You gain proficiency in the Arcana skill. Any time you make an Intelligence (Arcana) check to recall information about a spellcaster, their method of casting spells, or the effect of a spell, you can add double your proficiency bonus to the result of the roll.

In addition, you can cast absorb elements as a 1st-level spell a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once) without expending a spell slot. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Any time you cast absorb elements, and the first melee weapon attack you make on your next turn is against the creature whose spell you absorbed, you treat the additional damage from absorb elements as it's maximum roll.

description.p: Your training as a Spellbreaker has given you the unique ability to detect the magical ability of other creatures. Upon reaching 3rd level, as an action choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. You immediately learn its spellcasting ability (if it has one), if it casts arcane or divine spells, and the level of the highest spell the creature can cast.
Once you use this feature you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: As an action choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. You immediately learn its spellcasting ability (if it has one), if it casts arcane or divine spells, and the level of the highest spell the creature can cast.

description.p: Starting at 7th level when you are forced to make a saving throw for a spell or other magical effect, you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

description.p: You have learned the signature mage slaying technique of a master spellbreaker. Beginning at 11th level, you can use a bonus action to imbue your weapon attacks with the primal magic of the natural world. For the rest of your turn, each time you hit a creature with a weapon attack, all damage dealt by the attack becomes force damage, and you gain a bonus to the damage roll of your attacks equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

If the target of the attack is concentrating on a spell, it takes an additional 1d8 force damage, and it makes it's Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on it's spell with disadvantage.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: Upon reaching 15th level, your training as a Spellbreaker has reached its apex, and your blood has developed an innate magical ward. You have resistance to all damage from spells and other magical effects.

description.p: Throughout time, mortals have looked to the stars for the stories of the past, guidance in the present moment, and glimpses of their futures. Long have people believed that a true master of reading the heavenly bodies could draw upon their power to influence fate.

Stargazers take this devotion to the celestial bodies above and use it as a basis for radiant magic. They spend their lives studying the night sky, and understand how to read the threads of fate by observing the stars. Stargazers align themselves with the position of the stars to gain enhanced combat ability, grant guidance to their allies, and deliver radiant wrath to their foes. These strange and esoteric rangers are powerful allies and fearsome foes.

sheet.description: Stargazers align themselves with the position of the stars to gain enhanced combat ability

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Stargazer Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.
Starting at 3rd-level, your ability to guide using the stars becomes supernaturally accurate. You learn the guidance cantrip, which counts as a ranger spell for you.
In addition, you cannot become lost, even by magical means, as long as you have a clear view of the night sky.

sheet.description: You learn the guidance cantrip, which counts as a ranger spell for you. In addition, you cannot become lost, even by magical means, as long as you have a clear view of the night sky.

description.p: Upon adopting the traditions of the Stargazer at 3rd-level, you learn to let the celestial bodies guide your actions. At the end of a long rest you choose one of the constellations listed below, gaining its abilities until the end of your next long rest.

Adder. The adder allows you to strike beyond your normal reach. The range of your melee attacks increases by 5 feet, and when you make a ranged weapon attack at the weapon's long range you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll.

Falcon. As a bonus action on your turn, you can allow the falcon to grant you supernatural aim. For the rest of your current turn, you gain a bonus to your attack rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

Wolf. The wolf allows you to lead your allies like the alpha leads its pack. You can use the Help action as a bonus action. Additionally, when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 15 feet of you, as long as the target can see or hear you.

description.p: Starting at 7th-level, your connection to the stars allows you to alter both you fate, and the fates of those around you in minor ways. When you, or a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, makes an ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) to the roll.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, your connection to the stars allows you to enter a trance where the celestial bodies guide your actions. As a bonus action you can enter this trance, your eyes fill with starlight, and any time you make an attack roll you can treat a roll on the d20 of 9 or lower as a 10.
The trance lasts for up to 1 minute, or until you are knocked unconscious. Once you use this ability you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.
